textContent:
My threshold should be just enough work that I have enough time in the day for lunch, downtime and ending slightly before the end of the day. If I have more to do on most days than I can get done i either have too much, not enough help or going too fast

Expectations are what I calibrate them to be. I need to remain diligent about calibrating my expectations with those around me.

What if the job I have is taking on too much responsibility for my life? I'm taking on responsibilities beyond what I'm asked to do but in doing so I'm compromising my time and my mind space. The job and work could all be what I want to do but it's coming in the way of my responsibility to raise my son's, be a loving husband, take care of my house, be a caring family member, a generous neighbor. The responsibility of living is significant and the job monopolizes a significant amount of my time and thinking. My job really is the top priority because it comes ahead of everything else. How can I pull pack from my job while continuing to remain fulfilled at work? 

I can chose to take on less work 
I can ask for help 
I can ask for more time to do the work, going slower. 

//

I need to write. daily. learning how to articulate and tell the stories that give ideas. using frameworks as background for the writings and their objectives. i can write anywhere. i can do this
